page.title: 09THE HARBOUR IN 1985
page.content:
FISHING.
BUCKIE HARBOUR IS NO LONGER ONE OF THE MAIN FISH LANDING PORTS IS SCOTLAND. BUCKIE STILL HAS A CONSIDERABLE FISHING FLEET BUT MOST OF THE BOATS NOW WORK OUT OF PETERHEAD, OR WEST COAST PORTS SUCH AS LOCHINVER, KINLOCHBERUIE, AND MALLAIG. HOWEVER, IN 1985 THERE HAS BEEN AN INCREASE IN FISH LQNDINGS AT BUCKIE AND A PARTICULAR FEATURE HAS BEEN DANISH SHRIMP FISHERMEN LANDING THEIR CATCH AT BUCKIE. THIS WAS FIRST STIMULATED BY A STRIKE IN PROCESSING FACTORIES IN DENMARK BUT LANDINGS STILL CONTINUE AT BUCKIE WELL AFTER THE STRIKE HAS BEEN SOLVED. MORAY SEAFOODS FACTORY PROVIDES THE MAIN MARKET FOR THE SHRIMPS. BUCKIE FISHING BOATS CARRY THE REGISTRATION LETTERS BCK.
